publicwhip.spmotion: *S2M-1186 John Swinburne: Death of Ronnie Simpson-That the Parliament expresses its sadness at the sudden passing of Ronnie Simpson; recognises his contribution to national and international football and to goalkeeping from the beginning of his career at Queen's Park Football Club at the age of 14, as well as periods at Third Lanark Football Club, Hibernian Football Club and Newcastle United Football Club where he won two FA cup winners' medals, his caps for Scotland and, in particular, his role as the last line of defence in Celtic Football Club's greatest-ever victory when they won the European Cup in 1967, and extends its condolences to his family and friends, including his fellow Lisbon Lions.
S2M-1186 Death of Ronnie Simpson (lodged on 21 April 2004) Brian Adam*, Tommy Sheridan*

S2M-1186 John Swinburne: Death of Ronnie Simpson-That the Parliament expresses its sadness at the sudden passing of Ronnie Simpson; recognises his contribution to national and international football and to goalkeeping from the beginning of his career at Queen's Park Football Club at the age of 14, as well as periods at Third Lanark Football Club, Hibernian Football Club and Newcastle United Football Club where he won two FA cup winners' medals, his caps for Scotland and, in particular, his role as the last line of defence in Celtic Football Club's greatest-ever victory when they won the European Cup in 1967, and extends its condolences to his family and friends, including his fellow Lisbon Lions. Supported by: Brian Adam, Tommy Sheridan
S2M-1186 Death of Ronnie Simpson (lodged on 21 April 2004) Linda Fabiani*, Scott Barrie*, Donald Gorrie*
S2M-1186 Death of Ronnie Simpson (lodged on 21 April 2004) Bill Butler*, Colin Fox*, Mr Adam Ingram*, Fiona Hyslop*
S2M-1186 Death of Ronnie Simpson (lodged on 21 April 2004) Phil Gallie*
